channel.description: Recent content in Reinforcement Learning on ðŸ§ RL Journal Club

item.title: Learning When to Plan and When to Use Tools: WebGPT vs ReTool
item.description: A comparative study of two RL approaches that teach language models when and how to use tools. WebGPT uses browsing with a preference reward model. ReTool uses interleaved code execution with outcome rewards.

item.title: Actor-Critic vs. Value-Based: Empirical Trade-offs
item.description: An empirical comparison of Value-Based and Actor-Critic reinforcement learning algorithms across discrete and continuous action spaces, analyzing trade-offs in convergence speed, stability, and performance.
